homePage.description: Test your knowledge in a wide variety of categories — from science to pop culture — and compete with other experts for the title of the Knyaz of Knowledge!
homePage.aboutProjectDescription1: <0>Knuizz</0> is a quiz platform created to demonstrate full-stack development skills. The project is fully open source and continues to evolve.
homePage.aboutProjectDescription2: If you encounter any bugs, feel free to report them to my email: <1>r.belovs@inbox.lv</1>. This is a student pet project, so I'm sure it still has many errors.
homePage.featureQuickRoundsDescription: Play anytime, anywhere. One quiz round takes just a few minutes, perfect for short breaks.
homePage.featureApiDescription: A full-featured API for developers. Create your own clients, bots, or integrate quizzes into your applications.
homePage.featureRatingDescription: Track your achievements, compete with other players, and climb the leaderboard.

trivia_api.label: Trivia API Quiz
trivia_api.description: A set of random English questions on a variety of topics from the open Trivia API source. A great choice for a quick warm-up and knowledge check.

wwtbm_ru.label: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire
wwtbm_ru.description: Classic Russian-language questions from a database inspired by the famous TV show. The collection contains questions from the show as of December 2003. Author: Sergey Zubar.

wwtbm_en.label: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire
wwtbm_en.description: A database compiled by an anonymous user from Reddit, based on questions from GameFAQs in the format of the famous TV show "Who Wants to Be a Millionaire"
